article_node.title: Ohio’s Gen Z college students navigate Trump’s second term, from axing DEI to student loan changes
article_node.summary: Ohio college students are expressing deep concern over President Trump’s second‑term policies, citing the consolidation of power, the rollback of DEI initiatives, and the elimination of Grad PLUS loans as major catalysts for anxiety. The new federal student‑loan limits and the revocation of international student visas are prompting fears of financial hardship and disrupted academic plans. These developments are expected to influence student enrollment, career choices, and the broader higher‑education funding landscape in the coming years.
